unsavedChanges.title: You have unsaved changes.
unsavedChanges.desc: Do you want to save your changes before continuing?

automaticLiveView.label: Automatic Live View
automaticLiveView.desc: Automatically switch to a camera's live view when activity is detected. Disabling this option causes static camera images on the Live dashboard to only update once per minute.

playAlertVideos.label: Play Alert Videos
playAlertVideos.desc: By default, recent alerts on the Live dashboard play as small looping videos. Disable this option to only show a static image of recent alerts on this device/browser.

displayCameraNames.label: Always Show Camera Names
displayCameraNames.desc: Always show the camera names in a chip in the multi-camera live view dashboard.

storedLayouts.title: Stored Layouts
storedLayouts.desc: The layout of cameras in a camera group can be dragged/resized. The positions are stored in your browser's local storage.

cameraGroupStreaming.title: Camera Group Streaming Settings
cameraGroupStreaming.desc: Streaming settings for each camera group are stored in your browser's local storage.

defaultPlaybackRate.label: Default Playback Rate
defaultPlaybackRate.desc: Default playback rate for recordings playback.

firstWeekday.label: First Weekday
firstWeekday.desc: The day that the weeks of the review calendar begin on.

success.clearStreamingSettings: Cleared streaming settings for all camera groups.

birdClassification.title: Bird Classification
birdClassification.desc: Bird classification identifies known birds using a quantized Tensorflow model. When a known bird is recognized, its common name will be added as a sub_label. This information is included in the UI, filters, as well as in notifications.

semanticSearch.title: Semantic Search
semanticSearch.desc: Semantic Search in Frigate allows you to find tracked objects within your review items using either the image itself, a user-defined text description, or an automatically generated one.

reindexNow.label: Reindex Now
reindexNow.desc: Reindexing will regenerate embeddings for all tracked object. This process runs in the background and may max out your CPU and take a fair amount of time depending on the number of tracked objects you have.
reindexNow.confirmDesc: Are you sure you want to reindex all tracked object embeddings? This process will run in the background but it may max out your CPU and take a fair amount of time. You can watch the progress on the Explore page.

modelSize.label: Model Size
modelSize.desc: The size of the model used for semantic search embeddings.

small.title: small
small.desc: Using small employs a quantized version of the model that uses less RAM and runs faster on CPU with a very negligible difference in embedding quality.

large.title: large
large.desc: Using large employs the full Jina model and will automatically run on the GPU if applicable.

faceRecognition.title: Face Recognition
faceRecognition.desc: Face recognition allows people to be assigned names and when their face is recognized Frigate will assign the person's name as a sub label. This information is included in the UI, filters, as well as in notifications.

modelSize.label: Model Size
modelSize.desc: The size of the model used for face recognition.

small.title: small
small.desc: Using small employs a FaceNet face embedding model that runs efficiently on most CPUs.

large.title: large
large.desc: Using large employs an ArcFace face embedding model and will automatically run on the GPU if applicable.

licensePlateRecognition.title: License Plate Recognition
licensePlateRecognition.desc: Frigate can recognize license plates on vehicles and automatically add the detected characters to the recognized_license_plate field or a known name as a sub_label to objects that are of type car. A common use case may be to read the license plates of cars pulling into a driveway or cars passing by on a street.

toast.success: Enrichments settings have been saved. Restart Frigate to apply your changes.

cameraWizard.title: Add Camera
cameraWizard.description: Follow the steps below to add a new camera to your Frigate installation.

commonErrors.noUrl: Please provide a valid stream URL

step1.description: Enter your camera details and choose to probe the camera or manually select the brand.
step1.cameraNamePlaceholder: e.g., front_door or Back Yard Overview
step1.selectBrand: Select camera brand for URL template
step1.brandUrlFormat: For cameras with the RTSP URL format as: {{exampleUrl}}
step1.detectionMethodDescription: Probe the camera with ONVIF (if supported) to find camera stream URLs, or manually select the camera brand to use pre-defined URLs. To enter a custom RTSP URL, choose the manual method and select "Other".
step1.onvifPortDescription: For cameras that support ONVIF, this is usually 80 or 8080.
step1.useDigestAuthDescription: Use HTTP digest authentication when connecting to ONVIF-enabled cameras.

errors.brandOrCustomUrlRequired: Either select a camera brand with host/IP or choose 'Other' with a custom URL
errors.nameLength: Camera name must be 64 characters or less
errors.customUrlRtspRequired: Custom URLs must begin with "rtsp://". Manual configuration is required for non-RTSP camera streams.

step2.description: Probe the camera for available streams or configure manual settings based on your selected detection method.
step2.testFailed: Connection test failed. Please check your input and try again.
step2.rtspCandidatesDescription: The following RTSP URLs were found from the camera probe. Test the connection to view stream metadata.
step2.noRtspCandidates: No RTSP URLs were found from the camera. Your credentials may be incorrect, or the camera may not support ONVIF or the method used to retrieve RTSP URLs. Go back and enter the RTSP URL manually.
step2.toggleUriView: Click to toggle full URI view

step3.description: Configure stream roles and add additional streams for your camera.
step3.detectRoleWarning: At least one stream must have the "detect" role to proceed.

rolesPopover.title: Stream Roles
rolesPopover.record: Saves segments of the video feed based on configuration settings.

featuresPopover.title: Stream Features
featuresPopover.description: Use go2rtc restreaming to reduce connections to your camera.

step4.description: Final validation and analysis before saving your new camera. Connect each stream before saving.
step4.ffmpegModuleDescription: If the stream does not load after several attempts, try enabling this. When enabled, Frigate will use the ffmpeg module with go2rtc. This may provide better compatibility with some camera streams.
step4.saveError: Invalid configuration. Please check your settings.

issues.title: Stream Validation
issues.resolutionHigh: A resolution of {{resolution}} may cause increased resource usage.
issues.resolutionLow: A resolution of {{resolution}} may be too low for reliable detection of small objects.
issues.noAudioWarning: No audio detected for this stream, recordings will not have audio.
issues.audioCodecRecordError: The AAC audio codec is required to support audio in recordings.
issues.audioCodecRequired: An audio stream is required to support audio detection.
issues.restreamingWarning: Reducing connections to the camera for the record stream may increase CPU usage slightly.

brands.reolink-rtsp: Reolink RTSP is not recommended. Enable HTTP in the camera's firmware settings and restart the wizard.

dahua.substreamWarning: Substream 1 is locked to a low resolution. Many Dahua / Amcrest / EmpireTech cameras support additional substreams that need to be enabled in the camera's settings. It is recommended to check and utilize those streams if available.

hikvision.substreamWarning: Substream 1 is locked to a low resolution. Many Hikvision cameras support additional substreams that need to be enabled in the camera's settings. It is recommended to check and utilize those streams if available.

streams.title: Enable / Disable Cameras
streams.desc:
Temporarily disable a camera until Frigate restarts. Disabling a camera completely stops Frigate's processing of this camera's streams. Detection, recording, and debugging will be unavailable.
Note: This does not disable go2rtc restreams.

cameraConfig.description: Configure camera settings including stream inputs and roles.
cameraConfig.name: Camera Name
cameraConfig.nameLength: Camera name must be less than 64 characters.
cameraConfig.namePlaceholder: e.g., front_door or Back Yard Overview

ffmpeg.rolesRequired: At least one role is required
ffmpeg.rolesUnique: Each role (audio, detect, record) can only be assigned to one stream
ffmpeg.inputsRequired: At least one input stream is required

object_descriptions.title: Generative AI Object Descriptions
object_descriptions.desc: Temporarily enable/disable Generative AI object descriptions for this camera. When disabled, AI generated descriptions will not be requested for tracked objects on this camera.

review_descriptions.title: Generative AI Review Descriptions
review_descriptions.desc: Temporarily enable/disable Generative AI review descriptions for this camera. When disabled, AI generated descriptions will not be requested for review items on this camera.

review.title: Review
review.desc: Temporarily enable/disable alerts and detections for this camera until Frigate restarts. When disabled, no new review items will be generated.

reviewClassification.title: Review Classification
reviewClassification.desc: Frigate categorizes review items as Alerts and Detections. By default, all person and car objects are considered Alerts. You can refine categorization of your review items by configuring required zones for them.
reviewClassification.noDefinedZones: No zones are defined for this camera.
reviewClassification.objectAlertsTips: All {{alertsLabels}} objects on {{cameraName}} will be shown as Alerts.
reviewClassification.zoneObjectAlertsTips: All {{alertsLabels}} objects detected in {{zone}} on {{cameraName}} will be shown as Alerts.
reviewClassification.objectDetectionsTips: All {{detectionsLabels}} objects not categorized on {{cameraName}} will be shown as Detections regardless of which zone they are in.

zoneObjectDetectionsTips.text: All {{detectionsLabels}} objects not categorized in {{zone}} on {{cameraName}} will be shown as Detections.
zoneObjectDetectionsTips.notSelectDetections: All {{detectionsLabels}} objects detected in {{zone}} on {{cameraName}} not categorized as Alerts will be shown as Detections regardless of which zone they are in.
zoneObjectDetectionsTips.regardlessOfZoneObjectDetectionsTips: All {{detectionsLabels}} objects not categorized on {{cameraName}} will be shown as Detections regardless of which zone they are in.

toast.success: Review Classification configuration has been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.

error.copyCoordinatesFailed: Could not copy coordinates to clipboard.

error.mustBeAtLeastTwoCharacters: Zone name must be at least 2 characters.
error.mustNotBeSameWithCamera: Zone name must not be the same as camera name.
error.alreadyExists: A zone with this name already exists for this camera.
error.mustNotContainPeriod: Zone name must not contain periods.
error.mustHaveAtLeastOneLetter: Zone name must have at least one letter.

error.text: Distance must be greater than or equal to 0.1.
error.mustBeFilled: All distance fields must be filled to use speed estimation.

error.mustBeGreaterOrEqualZero: Loitering time must be greater than or equal to 0.

error.mustBeGreaterOrEqualTo: Speed threshold must greater than or equal to 0.1.

delete.title: Confirm Delete
delete.desc: Are you sure you want to delete the {{type}} {{name}}?

error.mustBeFinished: Polygon drawing must be finished before saving.

zones.label: Zones

desc.title: Zones allow you to define a specific area of the frame so you can determine whether or not an object is within a particular area.

zones.clickDrawPolygon: Click to draw a polygon on the image.

name.title: Name
name.tips: Name must be at least 2 characters, must have at least one letter, and must not be the name of a camera or another zone.

inertia.title: Inertia
inertia.desc: Specifies how many frames that an object must be in a zone before they are considered in the zone. Default: 3

loiteringTime.title: Loitering Time
loiteringTime.desc: Sets a minimum amount of time in seconds that the object must be in the zone for it to activate. Default: 0

objects.title: Objects
objects.desc: List of objects that apply to this zone.

speedEstimation.title: Speed Estimation
speedEstimation.desc: Enable speed estimation for objects in this zone. The zone must have exactly 4 points.

speedThreshold.title: Speed Threshold ({{unit}})
speedThreshold.desc: Specifies a minimum speed for objects to be considered in this zone.

error.pointLengthError: Speed estimation has been disabled for this zone. Zones with speed estimation must have exactly 4 points.
error.loiteringTimeError: Zones with loitering times greater than 0 should not be used with speed estimation.

toast.success: Zone ({{zoneName}}) has been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.

motionMasks.label: Motion Mask

desc.title: Motion masks are used to prevent unwanted types of motion from triggering detection. Over masking will make it more difficult for objects to be tracked.

context.title: Motion masks are used to prevent unwanted types of motion from triggering detection (example: tree branches, camera timestamps). Motion masks should be used very sparingly, over-masking will make it more difficult for objects to be tracked.

motionMasks.clickDrawPolygon: Click to draw a polygon on the image.

polygonAreaTooLarge.title: The motion mask is covering {{polygonArea}}% of the camera frame. Large motion masks are not recommended.
polygonAreaTooLarge.tips: Motion masks do not prevent objects from being detected. You should use a required zone instead.

success.title: {{polygonName}} has been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.
success.noName: Motion Mask has been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.

objectMasks.label: Object Masks

desc.title: Object filter masks are used to filter out false positives for a given object type based on location.

objectMasks.context: Object filter masks are used to filter out false positives for a given object type based on location.
objectMasks.clickDrawPolygon: Click to draw a polygon on the image.

objects.title: Objects
objects.desc: The object type that applies to this object mask.

success.title: {{polygonName}} has been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.
success.noName: Object Mask has been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.

desc.title: Frigate uses motion detection as a first line check to see if there is anything happening in the frame worth checking with object detection.

Threshold.title: Threshold
Threshold.desc: The threshold value dictates how much of a change in a pixel's luminance is required to be considered motion. Default: 30

contourArea.title: Contour Area
contourArea.desc: The contour area value is used to decide which groups of changed pixels qualify as motion. Default: 10

improveContrast.title: Improve Contrast
improveContrast.desc: Improve contrast for darker scenes. Default: ON

debug.title: Debug
debug.detectorDesc: Frigate uses your detectors ({{detectors}}) to detect objects in your camera's video stream.
debug.desc: Debugging view shows a real-time view of tracked objects and their statistics. The object list shows a time-delayed summary of detected objects.

boundingBoxes.title: Bounding boxes
boundingBoxes.desc: Show bounding boxes around tracked objects

colors.label: Object Bounding Box Colors
colors.info:
• At startup, different colors will be assigned to each object label
  • A dark blue thin line indicates that object is not detected at this current point in time
  • A gray thin line indicates that object is detected as being stationary
  • A thick line indicates that object is the subject of autotracking (when enabled)

timestamp.title: Timestamp
timestamp.desc: Overlay a timestamp on the image

zones.title: Zones
zones.desc: Show an outline of any defined zones

motion.title: Motion boxes
motion.desc: Show boxes around areas where motion is detected
motion.tips:
Motion Boxes


Red boxes will be overlaid on areas of the frame where motion is currently being detected

regions.title: Regions
regions.desc: Show a box of the region of interest sent to the object detector
regions.tips:
Region Boxes


Bright green boxes will be overlaid on areas of interest in the frame that are being sent to the object detector.

paths.title: Paths
paths.desc: Show significant points of the tracked object's path
paths.tips:
Paths


Lines and circles will indicate significant points the tracked object has moved during its lifecycle.

objectShapeFilterDrawing.title: Object Shape Filter Drawing
objectShapeFilterDrawing.desc: Draw a rectangle on the image to view area and ratio details
objectShapeFilterDrawing.tips: Enable this option to draw a rectangle on the camera image to show its area and ratio. These values can then be used to set object shape filter parameters in your config.

management.title: User Management
management.desc: Manage this Frigate instance's user accounts.

user.title: Username
user.desc: Only letters, numbers, periods and underscores allowed.

createUser.title: Create New User
createUser.desc: Add a new user account and specify an role for access to areas of the Frigate UI.
createUser.usernameOnlyInclude: Username may only include letters, numbers, . or _

deleteUser.title: Delete User
deleteUser.desc: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the user account and remove all associated data.
deleteUser.warn: Are you sure you want to delete {{username}}?

passwordSetting.desc: Create a strong password to secure this account.

roleInfo.intro: Select the appropriate role for this user:
roleInfo.viewerDesc: Limited to Live dashboards, Review, Explore, and Exports only.
roleInfo.customDesc: Custom role with specific camera access.

management.title: Viewer Role Management
management.desc: Manage custom viewer roles and their camera access permissions for this Frigate instance.

success.userRolesUpdated_one: {{count}} user assigned to this role has been updated to 'viewer', which has access to all cameras.
success.userRolesUpdated_other: {{count}} users assigned to this role have been updated to 'viewer', which has access to all cameras.

createRole.title: Create New Role
createRole.desc: Add a new role and specify camera access permissions.

editCameras.title: Edit Role Cameras
editCameras.desc: Update camera access for the role {{role}}.

deleteRole.title: Delete Role
deleteRole.desc: This action cannot be undone. This will permanently delete the role and assign any users with this role to the 'viewer' role, which will give viewer access to all cameras.
deleteRole.warn: Are you sure you want to delete {{role}}?

role.title: Role Name
role.desc: Only letters, numbers, periods and underscores allowed.
role.roleOnlyInclude: Role name may only include letters, numbers, . or _
role.roleExists: A role with this name already exists.

cameras.title: Cameras
cameras.desc: Select cameras this role has access to. At least one camera is required.
cameras.required: At least one camera must be selected.

notificationSettings.title: Notification Settings
notificationSettings.desc: Frigate can natively send push notifications to your device when it is running in the browser or installed as a PWA.

notificationUnavailable.title: Notifications Unavailable
notificationUnavailable.desc: Web push notifications require a secure context (https://…). This is a browser limitation. Access Frigate securely to use notifications.

globalSettings.title: Global Settings
globalSettings.desc: Temporarily suspend notifications for specific cameras on all registered devices.

email.title: Email
email.desc: A valid email is required and will be used to notify you if there are any issues with the push service.

cameras.title: Cameras
cameras.desc: Select which cameras to enable notifications for.

success.registered: Successfully registered for notifications. Restarting Frigate is required before any notifications (including a test notification) can be sent.

apiKey.title: Frigate+ API Key
apiKey.validated: Frigate+ API key is detected and validated
apiKey.notValidated: Frigate+ API key is not detected or not validated
apiKey.desc: The Frigate+ API key enables integration with the Frigate+ service.

snapshotConfig.title: Snapshot Configuration
snapshotConfig.desc: Submitting to Frigate+ requires both snapshots and clean_copy snapshots to be enabled in your config.
snapshotConfig.cleanCopyWarning: Some cameras have snapshots enabled but have the clean copy disabled. You need to enable clean_copy in your snapshot config to be able to submit images from these cameras to Frigate+.

modelInfo.title: Model Information
modelInfo.modelSelect: Your available models on Frigate+ can be selected here. Note that only models compatible with your current detector configuration can be selected.

toast.success: Frigate+ settings have been saved. Restart Frigate to apply changes.

semanticSearch.title: Semantic Search is disabled
semanticSearch.desc: Semantic Search must be enabled to use Triggers.

management.title: Triggers
management.desc: Manage triggers for {{camera}}. Use the thumbnail type to trigger on similar thumbnails to your selected tracked object, and the description type to trigger on similar descriptions to text you specify.

table.name: Name
table.noTriggers: No triggers configured for this camera.

editTrigger.title: Edit Trigger
editTrigger.desc: Edit the settings for trigger on camera {{camera}}

deleteTrigger.title: Delete Trigger
deleteTrigger.desc: Are you sure you want to delete the trigger {{triggerName}}? This action cannot be undone.

name.title: Name
name.description: Enter a unique name or description to identify this trigger

error.minLength: Field must be at least 2 characters long.
error.invalidCharacters: Field can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens.
error.alreadyExists: A trigger with this name already exists for this camera.

type.title: Type
type.description: Trigger when a similar tracked object description is detected
type.thumbnail: Trigger when a similar tracked object thumbnail is detected

content.title: Content
content.imageDesc: Only the most recent 100 thumbnails are displayed. If you can't find your desired thumbnail, please review earlier objects in Explore and set up a trigger from the menu there.
content.textDesc: Enter text to trigger this action when a similar tracked object description is detected.

threshold.title: Threshold
threshold.desc: Set the similarity threshold for this trigger. A higher threshold means a closer match is required to fire the trigger.

actions.title: Actions
actions.desc: By default, Frigate fires an MQTT message for all triggers. Sub labels add the trigger name to the object label. Attributes are searchable metadata stored separately in the tracked object metadata.

error.min: At least one action must be selected.

step1.description: Configure the basic settings for your trigger.

step2.description: Set up the content that will trigger this action.

step3.description: Configure the threshold and actions for this trigger.
